subject: Public Speaking
title: Metaphor as a Persuasion Engine
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Metaphor as a Persuasion Engine.

hook.text: An iron curtain has descended across the continent. Churchill didn't describe a policy â€” he painted a picture.

buildup.text: Metaphors map one concept onto another. They let audiences understand complex ideas through familiar images.

discovery.text: Cognitive scientists found metaphors activate sensory brain regions. Hearing 'iron curtain' triggers visual processing.

twist.text: The danger: metaphors frame thinking. Calling immigrants a 'flood' triggers different reactions than 'newcomers.'

climax.text: Every metaphor is an argument disguised as description. Choosing your metaphor means choosing the audience's response.

punchline.text: A metaphor doesn't describe reality. It shapes it.

quiz.question: Why are metaphors powerful in persuasion?
options: They activate sensory processing and frame how audiences think
